message.content:
cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.MM 

The paper deals with the fusion of auditory and visual information for active speaker detection, which is a problem commonly addressed in computer vision (CV) and natural language processing (NLP) applications. Therefore, cs.CV and cs.CL are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also proposes a neural network-based approach, which falls under the scope of cs.NE (neural and evolutionary computing) and cs.SD (sound). Finally, the paper mentions social robotics, which is a subfield of multimedia (cs.MM).
